pr_title: Eliminate pushed down filters above table scan in SQL Server connector

timeline.bodyText: why ProjectNode and not, say, AggregationNode?
timeline.author: findepi

replies.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText: Or we can add isCorrectlyPushedDown(Class<? extends PlanNode> allowedRetainedNodes)
replies.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText:
i got the plan:
presto:dbo> explain SELECT DISTINCT short_decimal, min(long_decimal) FROM test_aggregation_pushdown GROUP BY short_decimal;
                                                                                                                                         Query Plan
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Fragment 0 [SINGLE]
     Output layout: [short_decimal, _presto_generated]
     Output partitioning: SINGLE []
     Stage Execution Strategy: UNGROUPED_EXECUTION
     Output[short_decimal, _col1]
     │   Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10)]
     │   Estimates: {rows: ? (?), cpu: ?, memory: ?, network: ?}
     │   _col1 := _presto_generated
     └─ RemoteSource[1]
            Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10)]

 Fragment 1 [HASH]
     Output layout: [short_decimal, _presto_generated]
     Output partitioning: SINGLE []
     Stage Execution Strategy: UNGROUPED_EXECUTION
     Project[]
     │   Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10)]
     │   Estimates: {rows: ? (?), cpu: ?, memory: ?, network: ?}
     └─ Aggregate(FINAL)[short_decimal, _presto_generated][$hashvalue]
        │   Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10), $hashvalue:bigint]
        │   Estimates: {rows: ? (?), cpu: ?, memory: ?, network: ?}
        └─ LocalExchange[HASH][$hashvalue] ("short_decimal", "_presto_generated")
           │   Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10), $hashvalue:bigint]
           │   Estimates: {rows: ? (?), cpu: ?, memory: ?, network: ?}
           └─ RemoteSource[2]
                  Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10), $hashvalue_0:bigint]

 Fragment 2 [SOURCE]
     Output layout: [short_decimal, _presto_generated, $hashvalue_1]
     Output partitioning: HASH [short_decimal, _presto_generated][$hashvalue_1]
     Stage Execution Strategy: UNGROUPED_EXECUTION
     Aggregate(PARTIAL)[short_decimal, _presto_generated][$hashvalue_1]
     │   Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10), $hashvalue_1:bigint]
     └─ ScanProject[table = sqlserver:dbo.test_aggregation_pushdown master.dbo.test_aggregation_pushdown columns=[short_decimal:decimal(9,3):decimal, min("long_decimal"):_presto_generated_1:decimal(30,10):decimal] groupingSets=[[short_decimal:decimal(9,3):decimal]], group
            Layout: [short_decimal:decimal(9,3), _presto_generated:decimal(30,10), $hashvalue_1:bigint]
            Estimates: {rows: ? (?), cpu: ?, memory: 0B, network: 0B}/{rows: ? (?), cpu: ?, memory: 0B, network: 0B}
            $hashvalue_1 := combine_hash(combine_hash(bigint '0', COALESCE("$operator$hash_code"("short_decimal"), 0)), COALESCE("$operator$hash_code"("_presto_generated"), 0))
            short_decimal := short_decimal:decimal(9,3):decimal
            _presto_generated := min("long_decimal"):_presto_generated_1:decimal(30,10):decimal

i see Agg is not pushed down.
what plan do you get here?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
This is different Agg, right? This is distinct converted to aggregation.
The min is being pushed down.
IDK how to cover it accurately without writing matcher for whole expected plan.
replies.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText:
The point is -- there are two aggregations, one on top of the other.
isNotFullyPushedDown(AggregationNode) would be correct, since the upper agg is indeed not pushed
we currently cannot express the fact that the lower one is pushed, but maybe we can assume it's mostly covered by simpoler test cases
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: Sure. I can change the extra expected node to AggregationNode. But I will still leave the comment to explain what is happening there.
replies.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText:
I take that back. I cannot put AggregateNode there.
As isNotFullyPushedDown then expectes a plan like that:
- anyTree
    - node(AggregationNode)
        - node(TableScanNode)

And we also have an extra ProjectNode below Aggregation.
replies.author: losipiuk

timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: not relly - copied from somewhere. removing
replies.author: losipiuk

timeline.message: Eliminate pushed down filters above table scan in SQL Server connector
